page.title: 03WORMBRIDGE SCHOOL (2)
page.content: The{school building}has been altered and extended over the years. The earliest recorded use of the building as a school was around 1870, and early in the building's life as a school a schoolhouse was added. Part of this house was incorporated in the school early in the 20th century to form an infant's classroom, which in 1972 was superseded by a{prefabricated {classroom.}Other improvements include the addition of cloakrooms and a school meals scullery after World War Two and the replacement of the bucket privies by flush toilets in a brick built extension to the cloakroom in 1970.The old building was heated by a coke burning{'tortoise' type stove until 1983.Subsequently{Calor Gas } heating was installed. The prefabricated building is heated by electric storage radiators.
